items.subscaleItem: Feeling that diabetes is taking up too much of my mental and physical energy every day
items.stampleyPrompt: Did it feel like diabetes took up a lot of your energy today — mentally or physically?
items.validationLine: It’s understandable to feel drained — diabetes requires constant attention.
items.skillObjective: Regulate stress and reset focus when energy feels low.
items.educationChip: Breathing slowly helps activate your body’s relaxation response.
items.affirmation: Even one calm breath helps you recharge.

items.subscaleItem: Feeling that diabetes is taking up too much of my mental and physical energy every day
items.stampleyPrompt: What part of diabetes took up the most energy for you today — your thoughts, emotions, or physical routines?
items.validationLine: That makes sense — balancing all of this can be exhausting.
items.skillObjective: Help participants notice where energy goes and where they can rest.
items.educationChip: Checking where your energy goes helps you decide what really needs attention.
items.affirmation: You’re learning to manage your energy wisely.

items.subscaleItem: Feeling that diabetes is taking up too much of my mental and physical energy every day
items.stampleyPrompt: It sounds like diabetes has been taking up almost all of your energy. What’s one small thing that might help lighten the load?
items.validationLine: You’ve been working really hard — it’s okay to take breaks when needed.
items.skillObjective: Reduce guilt about rest and restore self-kindness.
items.educationChip: Treating yourself with care helps your body recover from stress and fatigue.
items.affirmation: Rest is not failure — it’s fuel for the next step.
